# Bread and butter
Does it really fall down with a butter at the bottom?

## Rectangle model
Let us solve it

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Input"  >{String.raw`Graphics @@ {{
  LightOrange, Rectangle[{-1, 0.7}, {1,1}],
  Brown, Rectangle[{-1,-1}, {1, 0.6}]
}, AspectRatio->1/3}`}</wljs-editor>

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Output"  >{String.raw`(*VB[*)(Graphics[{RGBColor[1, 0.9, 0.8], Rectangle[{-1, 0.7}, {1, 1}], RGBColor[0.6, 0.4, 0.2], Rectangle[{-1, -1}, {1, 0.6}]}, AspectRatio -> 1/3])(*,*)(*"1:eJxTTMoPSmNkYGAoZgESHvk5KWlMIB4HkHAvSizIyEwuTmOByftkFpekMcPkg9ydnPNz8osyQfqLzp4BgTf2RbNmgsBLe4hBnCCFqckliXnpOakQIZhJmf+BoCgNDJ7Zo8mBzAQTmPYVGYPBY5hVN2GMk0TaCSaw2Ac3GCEXVJqTWswNZDgWFwBNDEosycxHhBCYm5eYA3EtyKEAcwVfAw=="*)(*]VB*)`}</wljs-editor>

Add center of mass to the equation asumming that the butter is denser that our bread. In general the positon of our body can be described as $\mathbf{r}$ and $\mathbf{L}$ vector

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Input"  >{String.raw`r = {0,0};
\[CapitalOmega] = 0;`}</wljs-editor>

Estimate densoty of butter and bread and calcualte center of mass

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Input"  >{String.raw`{(*BB[*)(SemanticInterpretation["density of butter "])(*,*)(*"1:eJxTTMoPSmNhYGAo5gcSAUX5ZZkpqSn+BSWZ+XnFaYwgCV4gEZaZWu6SmpxflFiSXxTMARQJTs1NzCvJTE5jAqkBmRBUmpMazAaSKinKzEsHi4UUlaaiqeACCSdm5kBUBYMklWKxqPFITUyBqpFAss8zryS1qKAotSQR5MRoJQAneDHG"*)(*]BB*), (*BB[*)(SemanticInterpretation["density of bread "])(*,*)(*"1:eJxTTMoPSmNhYGAo5gcSAUX5ZZkpqSn+BSWZ+XnFaYwgCV4gEZaZWu6SmpxflFiSXxTMARQJTs1NzCvJTE5jAqkBmRBUmpMazAaSKinKzEsHi4UUlaaiqeACCSdm5kBUBYMklWKxqPFITUyBqpFAss8zryS1qKAotSQR5MRoJQAneDHG"*)(*]BB*)}`}</wljs-editor>

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Output"  >{String.raw`{(*VB[*)(Quantity[0.9467926356516039865\`2., "Grams"/"Centimeters"^3])(*,*)(*"1:eJxTTMoPSmNkYGAoZgESHvk5KWnMIB4vkAjLTC13SU3OL0osyS8K5gCKBJYm5pVkllQGSQA5BnqWJmbmlkZmxqZmpoZmBsaWFmamCUZ6aUwgA1iBREhmbmoxghuQX55aFMwNZDmnAo3JTS1JLSrO/Pv///9gkLR7UWJuMQBFQiRs"*)(*]VB*),(*VB[*)(Quantity[0.3807885439396734295\`2., "Grams"/"Centimeters"^3])(*,*)(*"1:eJxTTMoPSmNkYGAoZgESHvk5KWnMIB4vkAjLTC13SU3OL0osyS8K5gCKBJYm5pVkllQGSQA5BnrGFgbmFhamJsaWxpZm5sYmRpamCUZ6aUwgA1iBREhmbmoxghuQX55aFMwNZDmnAo3JTS1JLSrO/Pv///9gkLR7UWJuMQBF9iRv"*)(*]VB*)}`}</wljs-editor>

We need only the ratio, therfore assuming the same width, height of our layer, but different thickness we get 

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Input"  >{String.raw`density = QuantityMagnitude /@ <|"ðŸ§ˆ"->(*VB[*)(Quantity[19/20, "Grams"/"Centimeters"^3])(*,*)(*"1:eJxTTMoPSmNkYGAoZgESHvk5KWnMIB4vkAjLTC13SU3OL0osyS8K5gCKBJYm5pVkllSmMYHUgESCEksy8/MSczKFgZxMESABkWMFEiGZuanFCG5AfnlqUTA3kOWcCjQlN7Uktag48+////+DQdLuRYm5xQAhnCQG"*)(*]VB*), "ðŸž"->(*VB[*)(Quantity[19/50, "Grams"/"Centimeters"^3])(*,*)(*"1:eJxTTMoPSmNkYGAoZgESHvk5KWnMIB4vkAjLTC13SU3OL0osyS8K5gCKBJYm5pVkllSmMYHUgESCEksy8/MSczKFgZxMIyABkWMFEiGZuanFCG5AfnlqUTA3kOWcCjQlN7Uktag48+////+DQdLuRYm5xQApOiQk"*)(*]VB*)|>;

mean[g_, \[Rho]_] := (*FB[*)(((*TB[*)Integrate[(*|*)( g[d] \[Rho][d] )(*|*), {(*|*)d(*|*),(*|*)-1(*|*),(*|*)1 (*|*)}](*|*)(*1:eJxTTMoPSmNiYGAo5gESnnklqelFiSWpTvkVmYwgURYgEVJUmgoAvmMJeQ==*)(*]TB*))(*,*)/(*,*)((*TB[*)Integrate[(*|*)( \[Rho][d] )(*|*), {(*|*)d(*|*),(*|*)-1(*|*),(*|*)1 (*|*)}](*|*)(*1:eJxTTMoPSmNiYGAo5gESnnklqelFiSWpTvkVmYwgURYgEVJUmgoAvmMJeQ==*)(*]TB*)))(*]FB*) `}</wljs-editor>

Now we have a general function to calcualte mean values. Our center mass position will be

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Input"  >{String.raw`centerOfMass = {0, mean[#&, (*TB[*)Piecewise[{{(*|*)density["ðŸ§ˆ"](*|*),(*|*)# >= 0.6(*|*)},{(*|*)density["ðŸž"](*|*),(*|*)True(*|*)}}](*|*)(*1:eJxTTMoPSmNkYGAo5gESAZmpyanlmcWpTvkVmUxAAQBzVQdd*)(*]TB*) &]};

Graphics @@ {{
    LightOrange, Rectangle[{-1, 0.7}, {1,1}],
    Brown, Rectangle[{-1,-1}, {1, 0.6}],
    Red, Disk[centerOfMass, 0.1 {1/3, 1}], 
    AbsoluteDashing[{4}],
    Line[{{-1,0}, {1,0}}], Line[{{0,1}, {0,-1}}]
}, AspectRatio->1/3}`}</wljs-editor>

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Output"  >{String.raw`(*VB[*)(Graphics[{RGBColor[1, 0.9, 0.8], Rectangle[{-1, 0.7}, {1, 1}], RGBColor[0.6, 0.4, 0.2], Rectangle[{-1, -1}, {1, 0.6}], RGBColor[1, 0, 0], Disk[{0, 0.18461538461538463}, {0.03333333333333333, 0.1}], AbsoluteDashing[{4}], Line[{{-1, 0}, {1, 0}}], Line[{{0, 1}, {0, -1}}]}, AspectRatio -> 1/3])(*,*)(*"1:"*)(*]VB*)`}</wljs-editor>

## Theorem of center mass dynamics
Accoruding to II NEwton's law, we shall write equations

$$
\alpha
$$

There must be a threshold, when our butter starts to flip. Due to the reaction force $\sum \mathbf{F}_i = 0$ acting on the cetner of mass, we only need to think about

<wljs-editor display="codemirror" type="Output"  >{String.raw`{0,-pz rx,0}`}</wljs-editor>
